title: Synthesis and Microscopic Characterization of Nanoparticles NiCo by Reactive Mechanical Grinding
content: This research applies the reactive mechanical grinding method to produce alloyed Nickel-Cobalt (Ni-Co) nanoparticles. The synthesis process involves the chemical reduction of NiCl2 and CoCl2. NaCl is also added to dilute and reduce the coalescence of the reaction products. Sample preparation is carried out within a vacuum chamber to avoid oxidation of the metals in the sample. The reagents have been set in stoichiometric proportions according to reaction (1) for 3 g of mixture. Reagents comply with an atomic proportion of 50% of Ni and Co in a 1:1 ratio with NaCl as dispersant. Reagents and dispersant are placed in a vial along with the grinding balls. The applied mass ratio of balls has been 1:1 with respect to the total mass of the reactants. The vials have been loaded in a vacuum chamber. The following reaction is assumed to occur instantaneously and discontinuously as a result of the collisions between the grinding media and the reactants.
